triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: The paper builds on existing large language models as the foundation for developing LLM agents.

triples.name: Decision-making
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the application of LLMs to decision-making tasks.

triples.name: Fine-tuning (deep learning)
triples.relevance: The paper discusses finetuning as an existing approach and contrasts it with the proposed ExpeL method.

triples.name: GPT-4
triples.relevance: The paper mentions GPT-4 as an example of state-of-the-art language models accessible through API calls.

triples.name: Claude (language model)
triples.relevance: The paper mentions Claude as an example of state-of-the-art language models accessible through API calls.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: The paper explores the transfer learning potential of the ExpeL agent through qualitative observations and experiments.

triples.name: Experiential learning
triples.relevance: The paper introduces the Experiential Learning (ExpeL) agent as a novel method for LLM agents to learn from experiences without parametric updates.
